   Beto O'Rourke
   stated on March 31, 2017 in a U.S. Senate campaign kickoff event in
   Dallas:
   "I’m one of two members of Congress out of 535 that takes no corporate
   cash, no political action committee money."

Toward the end
   of his remarks, he asked for personal campaign donations, adding to cheers
   and applause: "I’m one of two members of Congress out of 535 that takes no
   corporate cash, no political action committee money.

Our ruling

   O’Rourke said: "I’m one of two members of Congress out of 535 that takes
   no corporate cash, no political action committee money."

Share the Facts
   PolitiFact Rating:
   Half True
   "I’m one of two members of Congress out of 535 that takes no corporate
   cash, no political action committee money."
